name: Slow Cooker Jalapeno Popper Taquitos
author: themoodyfoodie
summary: These are a spicy twist on traditional taquitos. The slow cooker gives this recipe ease, while the flavors keep things exciting! Serve with sour cream, guacamole, or avocado ranch salad dressing.
ingredients: 1 (4 ounce) can diced jalapeno peppers with juice
1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Combine chicken thighs, cream cheese, jalapeno peppers with juice, green enchilada sauce, salt, and black pepper together in a slow cooker
Cook on High for 3 to 4 hours
Shred chicken with 2 forks and stir with sauce in the slow cooker to combine
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray
Spread tortillas out on a flat work surface and sprinkle pepperjack cheese evenly in the center of each tortilla
Spread about 2 tablespoons of chicken mixture over cheese on each tortilla
Tightly roll each tortilla and place, seam-side down, on the prepared baking sheet
Brush top and sides of each rolled tortilla with vegetable oil
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese melts, and tortillas start to brown, 10 to 15 minutes
Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Cook taquitos under the broiler until crisped, 2 to 3 minutes more
